intro: Boerhavia diandra, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to warm temperate and tropical regions. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit and produces small, pink to red flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture, giving it its common name. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in some areas. Botanically, it belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
